HDG.BC.content: only “beings” remain: what does that mean? > stand btwn 2 equally unavoidable limits: 1) we cast being away from us (das Sein wird von uns verworfen [cf. Freud foreclosure]) when we say Being “is” 2) can never disavow “Being” & “is” wherever we experience a being [“is” method]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: only “beings” remain: what does that mean? > stand btwn 2 equally unavoidable limits: 1) we cast being away from us (das Sein wird von uns verworfen [cf. Freud foreclosure]) when we say Being “is” 2) can never disavow “Being” & “is” wherever we experience a being [“is” method]

HDG.FS.content: xynon means same as koinon? > for Heraclitus, xynienai: going together; koinon merely katholon, the universal, i.e. “what belongs equally to all despite differences” [a going together that’s not the universal common] > co-belonging of xynon is differing (verschieden) (to diapheromenon), this alone can bring together (zusammenbringen): no night alone, no day alone, co-belonging of day/night (their very being) [not dialectic?]

motif.name: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]
motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

HDG.FS.linkedContent: xynon means same as koinon? > for Heraclitus, xynienai: going together; koinon merely katholon, the universal, i.e. “what belongs equally to all despite differences” [a going together that’s not the universal common] > co-belonging of xynon is differing (verschieden) (to diapheromenon), this alone can bring together (zusammenbringen): no night alone, no day alone, co-belonging of day/night (their very being) [not dialectic?]

HDG.OHF.content: historical consciousness gives itself task of overviewing “total fact of man (die ganze Tatsache Mensch),” bringing Dasein into view absolutely objectively > in this approach to past, the present of Dasein (Gegenwart des Daseins) is before itself in equally objective manner, & so is the future (not yet [Noch-nicht], just the present when calculated, anticipated by way of comparison): Spengler’s “decline of the West” not cheap witticism or whim, but consequential expression of historical consciousness: its inauthenticity thought through to the end [i.e. if we think of everything in this reductive way, then we have reduced our future]
